sen.j: 後藤 得三（ごとう とくぞう、1897年（明治30年）1月17日 - 1991年（平成3年）7月22日）は、シテ方喜多流能楽師。
sen.e: Tokuzo GOTO (January 17 1897 to July 22 1991) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]).
Tokuzo GOTO (17 January, 1897 - 22 July, 1991) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]).
sen.cmt: 他の英語によるウィキペディアのスタイルに合わせました。
sen.e: Tokuzo GOTO (17 January, 1897 - 22 July, 1991) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kita school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]).

sen.j: 十四世喜多六平太の高弟。
sen.e: A high-caliber disciple of the 14th Roppeita KITA.
A high-caliber disciple of the 14th Roppeita KITA.
A high-caliber disciple of the 14th Roppeita KITA.

sen.j: 後藤真平の次男として大阪に生まれる。
sen.e: Born in Osaka as the second son of Shinpei GOTO.
Born in Osaka as the second son of Shinpei GOTO.
Born in Osaka as the second son of Shinpei GOTO.

sen.j: 1909年上京、十四世喜多六平太に弟子入りする。
sen.e: In 1909, he went to Tokyo to apprentice himself to the 14th Roppeita KITA.
In 1909, he went to Tokyo to apprentice himself to the 14th Roppeita KITA.
In 1909, he went to Tokyo to apprentice himself to the 14th Roppeita KITA.
He made his debut with Shimai (Noh dance in simple costumes) "Kokaji" (Sword Craftsman).
sen.cmt: 能の解説の中に、「小鍛冶とは刀工をさしていう当時の言葉」とありましたので、この意味で英訳をつけてあります。
sen.e: He made his debut with Shimai (Noh dance in simple costumes) "Kokaji" (Sword Craftsman).
He made his debut with Shimai (Noh dance in simple costumes) "Kokaji" (Sword Craftsman).

sen.j: 1954年第一回能楽渡欧団の一員としてヴェネツィア・ビエンナーレに参加。
sen.e: Participated in Venice Biennale as a member of the first Noh group visiting Europe in 1954.
Participated in Venice Biennale as a member of the first Noh group visiting Europe in 1954.
Participated in Venice Biennale as a member of the first Noh group visiting Europe in 1954.

sen.j: 1957年第二回能楽渡欧団の一員としてパリ文化祭に参加。
sen.e: Participated in the Culture Fest in Paris as a member of the second Noh group visiting Europe in 1957.
sen.cmt: 「パリ文化祭」調べましたが正式名称が分かりません。パリで開かれた日本文化祭のようです。意味を取って訳してあります。
sen.e: Participated in the Culture Fest in Paris as a member of the second Noh group visiting Europe in 1957.
Participated in the Culture Fest in Paris as a member of the second Noh group visiting Europe in 1957.
Received the Award of the Japan Art Academy in 1963.
Received the Award of the Japan Art Academy in 1963.
Received the Award of the Japan Art Academy in 1963.
Received the National Art Festival Award in 1967.
Received the National Art Festival Award in 1967.
Received the National Art Festival Award in 1967.

sen.j: 1970年重要無形文化財保持者（人間国宝）認定。
sen.e: Designated as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1970.
Designated as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1970.
Designated as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure) in 1970.
Became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 1982.
Became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 1982.
Became a member of the Japan Art Academy in 1982.
Received the 3rd class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure in 1984.
Received the 3rd class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure in 1984.
Received the 3rd class of the Order of the Sacred Treasure in 1984.

sen.j: 兄に俳人後藤夜半（ごとう やはん）。
sen.e: Yahan GOTO, a haiku poet, is his older brother.
Yahan GOTO, a haiku poet, is his older brother.
Yahan GOTO, a haiku poet, is his older brother.

sen.j: 弟に喜多流十五世宗家喜多実。
sen.e: Minoru KITA, the 15th head of the leading family in the Kita school, is his younger brother.
Minoru KITA, the 15th head of the leading family in the Kita school, is his younger brother.
Minoru KITA, the 15th head of the leading family in the Kita school, is his younger brother.

sen.j: 1949年に観世栄夫が喜多流に転流した際に養子とするが、観世流に復籍した際に解消。
sen.e: He adopted Hideo KANZE in 1949, when Hideo transferred to the Kita school, but this adoption was dissolved when Hideo returned to the Kanze school.
He adopted Hideo KANZE in 1949, when Hideo transferred to the Kita school, but this adoption was dissolved when Hideo returned to the Kanze school.
He adopted Hideo KANZE in 1949, when Hideo transferred to the Kita school, but this adoption was dissolved when Hideo returned to the Kanze school.
